newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss retail sales rise 2.0 pct yr/yr in April.
newsitem.headline: Swiss retail sales rise 2.0 pct yr/yr in April.

text.p: Swiss retail sales rose 2.0 percent by value in April from a year earlier, but the rise reflected in part two additional days in the reporting month, the Federal Statistics Office said.
This follows a year-on-year fall of 0.8 percent in March and a 1.1 percent decline in April 1996.
Retail sales per selling day fell 5.6 percent compared with April 1996. Easter season sales also fell in March this year, whereas they were mostly in April last year, it said.
Combined sales in March and April 1997 rose 0.6 percent from the same two-month period in 1996.
Adjusted for inflation, the office said real retail turnover in April was 1.8 percent higher than last year, with sales of foods up 0.8 percent and clothes and textiles up by 2.6 percent.
For the first four months of 1997, the value of retail sales was 0.7 percent lower than in the same period of last year.
Adjusted for prices, the office said real sales fell 1.2 percent in the first four months of 1997 from the same 1996 period.
